lines.text: What is this, a hotel or a nursery?
A baby was just born here, thanks to Jim.
Congratulations...
What do you mean "thanks to Jim"?
I'd better get out of here. It might be catching.
It's lucky for you that I only learned how to write, not read.

[to Frenchy]
You stye on the eye of a flea on a thigh of a nit on the neck of a gnat!
Stop thinking so hard, Frenchy. You're liable to get yourself a bad headache.

[Speaking about Jim]
Men have been known to change.

Oh, lady, even I have been given up by women reformers! The biggest mistake a woman can make is to pick the wrong man and try to make him right. Why don't you go off somewhere and have a good cry and forget him?
Violence is not our creed.
Yeah, I know. And I believe in turning the other cheek... but you just run out of cheeks. It's time to start growing some religious muscle.
Mr. Burns, I've heard you were an honest man and good with a gun. But I also heard you confessed to weakness for liquor, cards and women.
Not women, your Honor. They ain't for the weak.

[Referring to Alicia]
What a gal!
You chigger-pickin' Don Juan! You just try pitchin' hay with her, and I'll shoot that lump you call a head right from under your cap!
In 1900 the Congress of the United States passed a law which made a young man in Wisconsin decide to prove - that money growas on trees.

[to Jim about Alicia]
Lucky for you my father never owned a shotgun - what about hers?

[to Frenchy]
I just want you to know I can see through that swamp you call a brain!

[Watching the fire destroy the claims building]
This is the most satisfying act of God I've ever had the pleasure of witnessing.

[Referring to the giant sequioas]
Biggest, boldest things in the whole world!

[to Jim]
Make you feel kinda small?
Nope... big! I'm the one that;s gonna knock 'em down!

[Noticing the group of Quaker women with their distinctive attire]
What are they all dressed up for?
There's a hallelujah colony around here... soul savers... rigid and religious.

[Referring to Alicia]
The dark-haired one can save my soul anytime.

[to Jim]
None of these religious colonists ever bother to accumulate much cash.
There's no need to.
You see, Jim, these are wonderful folks. They'll give yuh everything they got. If they haven't got anything to give you, they'll say a prayer for you.
You're gettin' in a rut, Jim. You'd better look out, and when a rut becomes deep enough, it becomes a grave... and you gotta couple partners likely to put you in it.

[to Jim]
The giant sequoias are more than trees, friend. They are the everlasting sign of our Creator's work... 4000 years old... as old as the Book and the Faith.
